title: Nobel Peace Prize Controversy - Machado Gives Medal to Trump
summary: 2025 Nobel Peace Prize awarded to María Corina Machado for 'tireless work promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela.' Trump had longstanding desire to win, claimed it would be 'big insult' to US if he didn't win. After Machado won, White House Communications Director: 'The Nobel Committee proved they place politics over peace.' Following Venezuela invasion, Machado offered to 'share' her Nobel Prize with Trump. Nobel Committee rejected, clarifying prize 'cannot be revoked, shared or transferred.' January 15, 2026: Machado had lunch with Trump at White House and physically presented her Nobel Peace Prize medal as a gift. Trump confirmed he would keep it. Norwegian lawmakers reacted with shock. Oslo professor called it 'completely unheard of,' 'disrespectful' and 'pathetic.'
keyFacts: 2025 Nobel Peace Prize awarded to María Corina Machado for 'tireless work promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela'
Trump had longstanding desire to win Nobel Peace Prize, repeatedly suggested he deserved it
Trump claimed it would be 'big insult' to the US if he did not win
After Machado won, White House Communications Director Steven Cheung: 'The Nobel Committee proved they place politics over peace'
Richard Grenell (Trump's Venezuela envoy) declared the 'Nobel Prize died years ago'
Following U.S. Venezuela invasion, Machado offered to 'share' her Nobel Prize with Trump
Nobel Committee rejected the request, clarifying prize 'cannot be revoked, shared or transferred'
Committee: While ownership of physical medal can change, the title does not transfer - Trump is not a Nobel Peace Prize laureate
January 15, 2026: Machado had lunch meeting with Trump at White House and physically presented her Nobel Peace Prize medal as a gift
Trump confirmed he would keep the medal, writing: 'Maria presented me with her Nobel Peace Prize for the work I have done'
Norwegian lawmakers reacted with shock and dismay
Professor Janne Haaland Matlary (University of Oslo) called it 'completely unheard of,' 'disrespectful' and 'pathetic'
Matlary said it undermined the value of the prize
Trump has been nominated for 2026 Nobel Peace Prize; decision to be announced October 2026
